See a couple of threads down:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/110669-KSP-crashes-after-a-few-reverts-or-launches](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/110669-KSP-crashes-after-a-few-reverts-or-launches)

If you check your process memory consumption and it steps up like mine does, then you're probably looking at the same problem. It seems to happen regardless of which mods you might be using, mods just make you crash faster (since you have less free memory for the program to leak in the first place. IE, this is a squad bug, not a mod bug.

So not not possible to stop memory leaks but reducing memory footprint and maximize available memory will reduce the frequency of the crashes. Got it! I hope they fix in 1.0, if it is not a mod with a memory leak.

[**Here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92235-Cross-Platform-Issues-Thread) is a partial fix from Claw:

The Above solution seemed to solve or significantly reduce the problem. I just ran for 2 hours with about a dozen reverts/recovers no crash. Marking solved.

The reason why those things work is because they reduce your base memory consumption, allowing you more memory leaks before the game will crash. I've been doing the same things in order to give myself more overheard.

Unfortunately it doesn't do anything to actually fix the memory leak (you will still crash eventually).
